page.title: 02EDUCATION IN LINTON
page.content: The Infants School was founded in 1815 as a Sunday school.Until 1974 there was a mixed primary school. When the village started to increase its population a new primary school was built on Linton Heights(230 pupils in 1985) There are approximately 205 pupils in the Infants School.The average in one class is about 30 . The children work about 25 hours a week.Each class goes on a trip a couple of times a year. We did a survey in Linton asking people what they thought about Education,and this is what we found. People mostly think that there aren't enough playgroups in Linton.The Linton Social Centre has a playgroup with about 20 children per day. By Lisa Musk,Charles Ashford-Hodges, Hayley Mallows,Peter Drummond.
